additionalContactPoints.title: Additional contact points
additionalContactPoints.description: An array of additional contact points that may be consulted for information. Additional contact points should each list the languages they operate in their name, and as structured data in the availableLanguage field.

availableLanguage.title: Available languages
availableLanguage.description: The languages the contact point operates in, using either two-letter [ISO639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes), or extended [BCP47 language tags](http://www.w3.org/International/articles/language-tags/). The use of lowercase two-letter codes from [ISO639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) is strongly recommended unless there is a clear user need for distinguishing the language subtype.

bidOpening.title: Bid opening
bidOpening.description: The date, time, place and other details of the public bid opening.

communication.title: Communication
communication.description: Modalities of communication about key events.

coveredBy.title: Covered by
coveredBy.description: The international legal instruments that the contracting process is covered by.

deliveryLocations.title: Delivery Locations
deliveryLocations.description: The locations where activity related to this tender will take place.

deliveryAddresses.title: Delivery Addresses
deliveryAddresses.description: The addresses to which, or where, goods or services related to this tender will be delivered.

hasOptions.title: Options used
hasOptions.description: Whether or not the buyer reserves the right to make additional purchases from the supplier, as long as the contract is valid.

participationFees.title: Participation fees
participationFees.description: Any fees applicable to bidders wishing to participate in the tender process. Fees can apply for accessing bidding documents or for submitting bids, or there can be a "win fee" payable by the successful bidder.

recurrence.title: Recurrence
recurrence.description: Information on the recurrence of the contracting process.

hasRecurrence.title: Has recurrence
hasRecurrence.description: Whether the contracting process is recurrent.

secondStage.title: Second stage
secondStage.description: Information about the second stage of a two-stage procedure (e.g. a restricted procedure, a competitive procedure with negotiation, a competitive dialogue or an innovation partnership).

selectionCriteria.title: Selection criteria
selectionCriteria.description: Information about the conditions for participation in a procedure.

techniques.title: Techniques
techniques.description: Information about the use of techniques, such as framework agreements, dynamic purchasing systems and electronic auctions.

competitive.title: Is the framework agreement call-off competitive?
competitive.description: Whether this call-off is competitive or not.

bidOpening.title: Bid opening
bidOpening.description: The date, time, place and other details of the public bid opening.

communication.title: Communication
communication.description: Modalities of communication about key events for this lot.

coveredBy.title: Covered by
coveredBy.description: The international legal instruments that the lot is covered by.

hasOptions.title: Options used
hasOptions.description: Whether the buyer reserves the right to make additional purchases from the supplier, as long as the contract is valid.

recurrence.title: Recurrence
recurrence.description: Information on the recurrence of the lot.

hasRecurrence.title: Has recurrence
hasRecurrence.description: Whether the contracting process is recurrent.

secondStage.title: Second stage
secondStage.description: Information about the second stage of a two-stage procedure (e.g. a restricted procedure, a competitive procedure with negotiation, a competitive dialogue or an innovation partnership).

selectionCriteria.title: Selection criteria
selectionCriteria.description: Information about the conditions for participation in a lot.

techniques.title: Techniques
techniques.description: Information about the use of techniques, such as framework agreements, dynamic purchasing systems and electronic auctions.

BidOpening.title: Bid opening
BidOpening.description: The date, time, place and other details of the public bid opening.

date.title: Date and time
date.description: The date and time of the bid opening.

location.title: Location
location.description: The place where the bid opening occurs.

address.title: Address
address.description: The address of the place where the bid opening occurs.

description.title: Details
description.description: Any other details about the bid opening (who can participate, whether authorization is needed, etc.).

Communication.title: Communication
Communication.description: Modalities of communication about key events.

atypicalToolName.title: Atypical tool name
atypicalToolName.description: The name of the tools and devices that are not generally available and that are required to communicate electronically with the buyer.

atypicalToolUrl.title: Atypical tool URL
atypicalToolUrl.description: The URL of the tools and devices that are not generally available and that are required to communicate electronically with the buyer.

noticePreferredPublicationDate.title: Notice preferred publication date
noticePreferredPublicationDate.description: The buyer's preferred date of publication of the notice (e.g. to avoid publication during a national holiday).

futureNoticeDate.title: Future notice date
futureNoticeDate.description: The estimated date of publication of the next sequential notice. For example, the next sequential notice for a planning notice might be a competition notice.

invitationToConfirmInterestDispatchDate.title: Invitation to confirm interest dispatch date
invitationToConfirmInterestDispatchDate.description: The estimated date of dispatch from the buyer to potential suppliers of the invitations to confirm interest. For example, when a planning notice is used as a call for competition, the buyer might simultaneously invite the potential suppliers that have expressed their interest to confirm their continuing interest.

documentAvailabilityPeriod.title: Document availability period
documentAvailabilityPeriod.description: The period during which documents can be accessed, or during which requests for access to documents can be submitted.

deliveryLocations.title: Delivery Locations
deliveryLocations.description: The locations where activity related to this tender, contract or license will be delivered.

deliveryLocation.title: Delivery Location
deliveryLocation.description: The location where activity related to this tender, contract or license will be delivered, or will take place.

deprecated.description: This field is deprecated in favour of `.deliveryLocations` to support items with multiple delivery locations.

deliveryAddresses.title: Delivery Addresses
deliveryAddresses.description: The addresses to which, or where, goods or services related to this tender, contract or license will be delivered.

deliveryAddress.title: Delivery Address
deliveryAddress.description: The address to which, or where, goods or services related to this tender, contract or license will be delivered.

deprecated.description: This field is deprecated in favour of `.deliveryAddresses` to support items with multiple delivery locations.

description.title: Description
description.description: A name or description of this location. This might include the name(s) of the location(s), or might provide a human-readable description of the location to be covered.

geometry.title: Geometry
geometry.description: We follow the [GeoJSON standard](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc7946) to express basic location information, using longitude, latitude, and optional elevation values in the [WGS84](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System) (EPSG:4326) projection. A point location can be identified by geocoding an address. For concession licenses, or other scenarios covering a polygon location that is not contained in a known gazetteer, polygon and multi-polygon can be used.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of [GeoJSON Geometry Objects](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc7946#section-3.1) being provided. To provide longitude, latitude, and optional elevation, use 'Point', and enter an array of [longitude, latitude] or [longitude, latitude, elevation] as the value of the coordinates field: e.g. [-122.085, 37.42].

coordinates.title: Coordinates
coordinates.description: The relevant array of points, e.g. [longitude, latitude] or [longitude, latitude, elevation], or a nested array of points, for the GeoJSON geometry being described. The longitude and latitude must be expressed in decimal degrees in the WGS84 (EPSG:4326) projection.

gazetteer.title: Gazetteer
gazetteer.description: Identifiers from a gazetteer (a geographical index or directory) for the location.

scheme.title: Gazetteer scheme
scheme.description: The identifier of the gazetteer. The `locationGazetteers.csv` codelist provides details of services, where available, that can resolve a gazetteer entry to provide location names.

identifiers.title: Identifiers
identifiers.description: An array of one or more codes drawn from the gazetteer indicated by the `scheme` field.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: A URI to a further description of the location. This might be a human-readable document with information on the location, or a machine-readable description of the location.

period.title: Period
period.description: The period over which the options can be used.

ParticipationFee.title: Participation fee
ParticipationFee.description: A fee applicable to bidders wishing to participate in the tender process. Fees can apply for accessing bidding documents or for submitting bids, or there can be a "win fee" payable by the successful bidder.

id.title: Fee ID
id.description: A local identifier for this fee, unique within this block. This field is used to keep track of multiple revisions of a fee through the compilation from release to record mechanism.

value.title: Value
value.description: The monetary value of this fee.

description.title: Description
description.description: Additional information about this fee, for example: the specific cases in which the fee is applicable (e.g. hard copies of documents only), the way in which the fee is levied, or the exact nature of the fee.

methodOfPayment.title: Method(s) of payment
methodOfPayment.description: The accepted ways in which fees can be paid.

Recurrence.title: Recurrence
Recurrence.description: Information on the recurrence of the contracting process.

dates.title: Estimated dates
dates.description: An estimate of the timing of subsequent initiations of contracting processes (e.g. notices of intended procurement).

description.title: Further information
description.description: Any further information on the recurrence of the contracting process.

SecondStage.title: Second stage
SecondStage.description: Information about the second stage of a two-stage procedure (e.g. a restricted procedure, a competitive procedure with negotiation, a competitive dialogue or an innovation partnership).

minimumCandidates.title: Minimum number of candidates
minimumCandidates.description: The minimum number of candidates to be invited for the second stage of the procedure. If there is an exact limit on the number of candidates, set `minimumCandidates` and `maximumCandidates` to the same number.

maximumCandidates.title: Maximum number of candidates
maximumCandidates.description: The maximum number of candidates to be invited for the second stage of the procedure. If there is an exact limit on the number of candidates, set `minimumCandidates` and `maximumCandidates` to the same number.

successiveReduction.title: Successive reduction
successiveReduction.description: The procedure will take place in successive stages. In each stage, some participants might be eliminated.

noNegotiationNecessary.title: No negotiation necessary
noNegotiationNecessary.description: The buyer or procuring entity reserves the right to award the contract on the basis of the initial bids without any further negotiations.

invitationDate.title: Invitation date
invitationDate.description: The estimated date of dispatch of the invitations to participate or to submit bids.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of the criteria used to select the economic operators who will be allowed to bid.

minimum.title: Minimum value or level
minimum.description: The minimum value or level of compliance a candidate needs to meet in order to participate.

appliesTo.title: Applies to
appliesTo.description: Whether the criterion applies to suppliers, subcontractors, or both.

forReduction.title: For reduction?
forReduction.description: Whether the criterion is used to select the potential suppliers to be invited to the second stage of the contracting process, if the number of invitations is limited.

techniques.title: Techniques
techniques.description: Information about the use of techniques, such as framework agreements, dynamic purchasing systems and electronic auctions.

Techniques.title: Techniques
Techniques.description: Information about the use of techniques, such as framework agreements, dynamic purchasing systems and electronic auctions.

hasFrameworkAgreement.title: Framework agreement involved
hasFrameworkAgreement.description: Whether a framework agreement is involved.

hasDynamicPurchasingSystem.title: Dynamic purchasing system involved
hasDynamicPurchasingSystem.description: Whether a dynamic purchasing system is involved.

dynamicPurchasingSystem.title: Dynamic purchasing system
dynamicPurchasingSystem.description: Information about the dynamic purchasing system.

hasElectronicAuction.title: Electronic auction used
hasElectronicAuction.description: Whether an electronic auction is used.

minimumParticipants.title: Minimum number of participants
minimumParticipants.description: The minimum number of participants in the framework agreement.

maximumParticipants.title: Maximum number of participants
maximumParticipants.description: The maximum number of participants in the framework agreement. If there is no maximum, set to 1e9999 (which parses to infinity).

method.title: Method
method.description: Whether contracts are awarded with, without, or both with and without the reopening of competition.

periodRationale.title: Duration rationale
periodRationale.description: The justification for exceptional cases when the duration of a framework agreement exceeds the legal limits.

buyerCategories.title: Buyer categories
buyerCategories.description: Any additional categories of buyers participating in the framework agreement and not mentioned by name (e.g. 'all hospitals in the Tuscany region').

value.title: Value
value.description: The total upper estimated value of the framework agreement.

period.title: Period
period.description: The period over which the framework agreement is estimated to be active.

description.title: Description
description.description: A summary description of the framework agreement. This complements any structured information provided using the other fields.

DynamicPurchasingSystem.title: Dynamic purchasing system
DynamicPurchasingSystem.description: Information about the dynamic purchasing system.

type.title: Type
type.description: In the case of central purchasing bodies, whether the dynamic purchasing system can be used by buyers not listed in the contracting process.

status.title: Status
status.description: The status of the dynamic purchasing system.

url.title: URL
url.description: The internet address of the electronic auction.

description.title: Description
description.description: Any additional information about the electronic auction.
